spookynights-quickstartguide-text:
- Quick Start Guide - Welcome to Spooky Nights. The world has changed. The nights are darker, the shadows are moving, and ancient spirits have awoken. This overhaul mod introduces a new layer of survival focused on horror, combat strategy, and supernatural metallurgy. Why stay in the dark? This mod is not just about harder enemies; it is about adaptation and reward. 1. A New Challenge Standard survival tactics won't work. Spectral enemies possess a Resistance that dulls your steel blades (-50% Damage). You can no longer rely solely on brute force; you must prepare. 2. Progressive Metallurgy Hunting these spirits rewards you with Spectral Hearts. These are the key to a new tier of metallurgy: Spectrium, Etherium, and Aetherium. Each alloy makes you a more efficient hunter, turning the predator into prey. 3. Strategic Combat The mod introduces the warscythe, a specialized polearm with massive reach (3.2m). Prefer your trusty Spear or Falx? You can craft standard Arrows, Spears, and Falx blades using the new spectral metals. This allows you to keep your preferred fighting style while gaining the damage necessary to pierce the veil. 4. Risk & Reward The Candy System adds a gambling element to your survival. Will that candy save your life with a burst of healing, or will it blind you in the middle of a fight? The choice is yours.
New Content Overview Entities: - Spectral Drifters, Bowtorns, shivers: Evolved forms of the common foe. - Spectral Wolves & Bears: Fast, aggressive, and glowing in the dark. Items: - Jack O' Lanterns: To light up your base. - Candy Bags: Lootable treats with random effects. - Spectral Weapons: Tools of destruction.
--- HANDBOOK NAVIGATION --- Click the links below to learn the details: Depending on your needs: - Combat Mechanics: Learn how to bypass damage resistance. - Metallurgy Guide: Recipes for Spectrium and alloys. - Weapon Stats: Details on the Warscythe and damage tiers. - Candy Effects: A list of all buffs and curses.
spookynights-guide-mechanics-text: - Spectral Resistance - Spectral entities are not bound by the same physical laws as the living. They are ethereal, causing ordinary matter to pass through them with little effect. The Resistance Any weapon forged from mundane materials (Copper, Bronze, Iron, Steel, Black Bronze...) will have its damage reduced by 50% when striking a spectral entity. This applies to both melee attacks and projectiles (arrows/spears). Breaking the Veil To hunt these creatures effectively, you must forge weapons using Spectrium or its alloys. These materials resonate with spectral energy. Damage Tiers: - Spectrium: Bypasses resistance entirely (100% Normal Damage). - Etherium: Inflicts +20% Bonus Damage to spectral entities. - Aetherium: Inflicts +40% Bonus Damage to spectral entities. Tip: Check your weapon's tooltip. Spectral weapons display their effective spectral damage in purple text.
spookynights-guide-metallurgy-text: - Metallurgy - To fight the spectral threat, you must master new metals. 1. Spectrium (Tier 2) The base metal for ghost hunting. It is not mined from the earth. - Source: Obtain Spectral Hearts by slaying spectral creatures. - Process: Crush the hearts in the crafting grid using a Hammer to obtain Nuggets. - Smelting: Melts at 1025°C. 2. Etherium (Tier 3) An alloy offering superior durability. - Mix: 30-40% Spectrium + 60-70% Copper. - Smelting: Melts at 1150°C. 3. Aetherium (Tier 3+) The ultimate spectral alloy, requiring rare materials. - Mix: ~40% Spectrium + ~40% Bismuth + ~20% Silver. - Smelting: Melts at 1025°C. These metals can be forged into Warscythes, Spears, Arrows, and Falx blades.
spookynights-guide-weapons-text: - Warscythe - While Spears and Arrows can be tipped with spectral metals, the Warscythe is the signature weapon of the ghost hunter. The Warscythe (Long) A polearm designed to keep deadly spirits at bay. - Reach: 3.2 meters (Outranges most enemies). - Damage: High cutting damage. - Drawbacks: Being heavy and unwieldy, it reduces Walk Speed by 15% and increases Hunger Rate by 30% while held. Weapon Stats (Warscythe): - Spectrium: 4.2 Dmg (550 Durability) - Etherium: 4.8 Dmg (1100 Durability) - Aetherium: 5.5 Dmg (1500 Durability) Note: Falx blades, Spears, and Arrows can also be crafted from these metals for standard handling without the Warcythe's penalties.
spookynights-guide-candies-text: - Trick or Treat - During your hunts, you may find Candy Bags. Hold Right-Click to open them and reveal 1 to 3 random sweets. Beware: each candy carries a curse along with its blessing. Spider Gummy (Common) - Treat: Grants a massive jump boost and negates fall damage for 10s. - Trick: Inflicts minor Poison damage (-2 hp). Mummy Candy (Common) - Treat: Heals 2 HP and prevents Knockback. - Trick: Slowness (-25%) for 45s. Ghost Caramel (Uncommon) - Treat: Restores Temporal Stability by 25%. - Trick: Weakness (-50% Damage) for 30s. Do not eat during combat! Vampire Teeth (Rare) - Treat: Large Heal (+6 HP). - Trick: Drains Temporal Stability (-30%). Shadow Cube (Rare) Pure Chaos. Effects are unpredictable: - Divine (5%): Full Healing + Max Saturation + Stability. - Speed (20%): Super speed boost (+50%) for 45s. - Hallucination (30%): Your vision blurs and you hear frightening sounds. - Darkness (25%): Walking speed -50% and darkness (15s). - Fail (20%): Teleports you nearby... Generally within a 10-block radius.
